They find rare cars and motorcycles that you won't find back in the states but they aren't able to seal every negotiation since they have to factor in the exchange rate between Euros and dollars, and the cost of shipping everything back home. Back in the states, Mike and Frank will once again haggle over a slew of interesting historic items and meet quirky and interesting characters. From rare Bonnie and Clyde memorabilia to a Bass Guitar that may have belonged to Bill Black, a legendary musician who played with Elvis, to a typewriter that supposedly was lent to Albert Einstein. Meanwhile, in Iowa, Danielle Colby is overseeing the Antique Archaeology store expansion and is holding down the fort.

episodes.name: The More You No
episodes.overview: Mike, Frank, Danielle and Robbie continue to double down in Virginia, but hit a roadblock with a seller who won't let go of a one-of-a-kind find.

episodes.name: Thunderdome
episodes.overview: It's make or break for the Virginia blitz strategy. Mike and Frank meet a real-deal motorcycle legend ready to clear out some of his high-octane stock, and a VIP pass to a unique mancave turns up a rare item that's old and odd.

episodes.name: Auburned Out
episodes.overview: Mike takes a gamble on a 1935 Auburn that's either a diamond in the rough or a total dud. The guys tread dangerous ground while picking an Iowa Harley enthusiast. And Dave unveils a project one year in the making that's also Mike's biggest-ever investment.

episodes.name: If You Talk Nice to Me
episodes.overview: Mike is on a mission to buy a rare cycle car he's coveted for more than two years, but they have to make it through a gauntlet of coin tosses and sweet talking to seal the big deals.

episodes.name: Let's Be Frank
episodes.overview: When Frank meets Frank, it's a match made in picking heaven; in Illinois, the guys discover a trove of unusual micro-cars.

episodes.name: Grudge Match
episodes.overview: It’s Frank vs. Mike when the guys take to the track for a grudge match drag race to see who has the fastest ride.

episodes.name: Escape to Motor Mountain
episodes.overview: The pickers discover a mountain of motorcycles, but it's protected by booby traps; and one stubborn collector stands in the way of the guys and a mega-warehouse mega-pick.

episodes.name: Everything Must Go
episodes.overview: They guys are on the trail of two vintage Harleys in Pennsylvania, but Frank gets more than he bargained for when one bike collector takes a liking to him.

episodes.name: Museum Man
episodes.overview: In Indiana, the guys discover a collection so big and rare it's enough to start a one-man museum, but how do you put a price on the priceless?

episodes.name: Big Moe
episodes.overview: Big Moe's negotiating skills have Mike feeling a bit small; and Pastor Bill lives every day like it's Christmas.

episodes.name: May the Ford Be With You
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank undertake a major excavation to unearth a rare vintage auto that hasn't seen daylight in decades, but could be worth a fortune.

episodes.name: The Pickin' or the Egg
episodes.overview: A Maine homestead reveals six generations of secrets, and NASCAR legend Ryan Newman proves that when it comes to negotiating, he’s just as tough as Danielle.

episodes.name: Let It Go
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank stage a picking intervention in Massachusetts and later, help a collector whose massive stockpile is facing eviction.

episodes.name: The Maineiacs
episodes.overview: The guys discover a reclusive octogenarian Maine-iac deep in the north woods, and pay a visit to Timtown–a one-man village with 42 jam-packed buildings.

episodes.name: From A to T
episodes.overview: Frank makes a shrewd bid that leads to a big discovery; Mike falls hard for two century-old cars.

episodes.name: Red Barn, Black Keys
episodes.overview: The Black Keys' frontman Dan Auerbach is set to short circuit Mike's plans to flip a vintage guitar; Sammy has a hard time parting with pieces of his family's history.

episodes.name: A Hard Rain's Gonna Fall
episodes.overview: A storm is brewing as Mike and Frank are determined to retrieve an iconic American sports car that's so rare they've never even heard of it.

episodes.name: Texas Hold 'Em
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank finally get access to their white whale pick, but not-for-sale Dennis earned his nickname for a reason; in Texas, the guys meet a collector who's filled an entire town with his mammoth stockpile.

episodes.name: Great Minds Ink Alike
episodes.overview: In Louisiana, Danielle calls the shots from HQ when the guys find themselves in over their heads; Frank strikes a side deal that leaves a permanent mark.

episodes.name: The Big Bet
episodes.overview: It's Frank vs. Mike in their biggest bet ever, and this time the stakes are personal. Will Frank keep his beard, or get himself a close shave?

episodes.name: Good & Evel
episodes.overview: An Evel Knievel super-fan reveals some of the legendary daredevil’s most personal items.

episodes.name: The Numbers Game
episodes.overview: The guys discover a rare 1930s coupe at Buckey’s one-man ranch; and the numbers aren’t in Mike’s favor when Frank shows off his beautiful mind.

episodes.name: The Georgia Gambler
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank try to beat the house against the Georgia Gambler, who plays for every price; Danielle and Robbie stumble on what could be a million-dollar find.

episodes.name: The Empire Picks Back
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank use the force to uncover a secret Star Wars stash in California; the guys try to make a deal on a mint ’56 Chevy Belair.

episodes.name: Red, White and Blues
episodes.overview: The guys unearth a music jackpot in an old general store, and a hoarder house holds on to its secrets.

episodes.name: The Bundle Brothers
episodes.overview: Two brothers are better than one when it comes to negotiating, which has Mike looking to bundle in order to save his bottom line.

episodes.name: Space Oddities
episodes.overview: Picking in New Mexico for the first time ever, the guys head straight to Roswell, but take a detour to a Wild West town with a million-dollar item for sale.

episodes.name: Daredevil Duffey
episodes.overview: A daredevil stuntman lives up to his legend in New Mexico and Mike looks for some divine intervention on a must-have pick.

episodes.name: Law and Hoarder
episodes.overview: A Texas attorney lays down the law by day and by night is a super picker with a wild warehouse of eclectic stuff.

episodes.name: From Coupe to Nuts
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank are unwelcome visitors while freestyling in the Northeast; rehabbing a rare and rusty ’33 Ford Coupe.

episodes.name: Coin-Op Kings
episodes.overview: The guys discover the ultimate coin-op man cave hidden on a farm in upstate New York, and Frank hatches a plan to help lonely collectors find love.

episodes.name: A Man's Home is His Castle
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank pick a family that spent 40 years building their very own castle by hand, and a circus collector with a wax museum in his living room.

9.name: Season 9
9.overview: Mike and Frank continue their mission to recycle America by rescuing forgotten relics and giving them a new lease on life, while learning a thing or two about American history along the way. In the season opener, Dan Auerbach of the Black Keys shows interest in a vintage Chet Atkins Gretsch guitar that Mike stumbled across in South Carolina. In upcoming episodes, Mike and Frank cover new territory, picking in New Mexico for the first time ever. It wouldn't be American Pickers without amazing classic cars, and this season features two particularly rare ones: a 1954 Red Nash Healey Coupe and a 1954 Grey Nash Healey Coupe. Also coming up, the guys find a building chock full of Star Wars memorabilia including a life-sized Storm Trooper and Yoda, causing Frank to geek out. A lot is at stake when Frank makes a big bet with Mike: If Mike can down six dozen oysters then Frank has to shave his beard.

episodes.name: Like Father, Like Daughter
episodes.overview: A retired auctioneer and his daughter have haggling in their blood; Mike has eyes for a long-sought 1930s Cord convertible.

episodes.name: Can't Catch a Break
episodes.overview: While Mike makes deal after deal, Frank hits a road block with a straight-talking Wisconsin collector who won't budge on prices.

episodes.name: The Superfan
episodes.overview: Mike makes a big league offer on an ultra-rare vintage Edison invention, and a mega stash of beer-related memorabilia stokes Frank's Oktoberfest mojo.

episodes.name: Oddities & Commodities
episodes.overview: The guys brave a collection that sends chills up the spine at a former gas station transformed into an eccentric home.

episodes.name: Beetle in a Haystack
episodes.overview: A lead on an ultra-rare VW beetle turns out to be a true barn find, but it’ll take a heavy metal move to bring it home.

episodes.name: Biggest Buys
episodes.overview: The top 12 big ticket items that Mike and Frank ever picked.

episodes.name: Best of the 60's
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank look back at their best picks from the 1960s, including a meeting with Captain Kirk and a seat in the original Batmobile.

episodes.name: Best of the 70's
episodes.overview: The guys take a trip down memory lane in this special episode featuring the grooviest picks from the disco decade.

episodes.name: Toughest Digs
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank look back on their trickiest excavations ever, including relics buried underground and awesome finds trapped under mountains of junk.

episodes.name: Have Yourself a Merry Pickers Christmas
episodes.overview: Mike tries to get Frank into the Christmas spirit while exploring two super packed picks.

episodes.name: Who's the Rarest of Them All?
episodes.overview: The guys find themselves in Studebaker heaven, and visit a designer with the rarest collection in the Midwest.

episodes.name: On the Road Again
episodes.overview: Mike takes an epic Route 66 road trip in an antique convertible to bring the car back to the widow of its previous owner. But the 1930s classic may not make it through the 600 mile journey.

episodes.name: What's Inside the Vault?
episodes.overview: When the guys visit a woman overwhelmed by an incredible inheritance, she opens the doors to a secret vault. And they meet their match in an 80-year-old rebel who speeds a mini bike around his massive property.

episodes.name: This One Stings
episodes.overview: Mike makes a mistake in Indiana, and while the guys get a warm reception from a carnie collector in Ohio, the pick brings an unexpected sting.

episodes.name: Full Speedo Ahead
episodes.overview: The guys visit a man with a puzzling nickname who hasn't thrown away anything since the 1950s, and isn't willing to start now. And he isn't shy about flaunting his favorite underwear, which comes as a shock to Mike and Frank.

episodes.name: Jersey's Jackpot
episodes.overview: When the guys do a favor for a friend, what seems like a raw deal becomes a surprising win-win situation. Plus, they get behind a locked door that hasn't been opened in decades.

episodes.name: A Few Good Junk Men
episodes.overview: The guys stumble on the mother lode of Americana in Maryland. Then, a former garbage man's trash is a real treasure.

episodes.name: Frank's Birthday
episodes.overview: Frank celebrates his birthday with a picking bonanza. Plus, the guys make a woman's dream come true by brokering a deal to honor her deceased husband.

episodes.name: Signs of Struggle
episodes.overview: Mike struggles to free a massive vintage sign from a tight corner, then the guys strike an impossible deal with the "Sign Boss." Back in Iowa, Danielle joins Frank for a final joyride in a 1956 Chevy.

episodes.name: A Colonel of Truth
episodes.overview: The guys pick the collection of a reclusive and mysterious businessman named "the Colonel," who has gone to great lengths to keep his identity a secret.

episodes.name: Tick Tock Pick
episodes.overview: The guys go hog wild at a sprawling ranch in Texas, where Mike flips for a VW bus that's been transformed into a hunting lodge on wheels. Plus, Frank finds a storied heirloom that reignites a high school obsession.

episodes.name: One Giant Pick for Mankind
episodes.overview: The guys uncover a former firefighter's stockpile which includes an ultra-rare piece of Space Age history. Plus, Frank's plan goes up in smoke.

episodes.name: Picked a Peck of Pepper
episodes.overview: The guys go big in Texas with a mega pick at the first Dr. Pepper bottling plant, and tough negotiations in a 50,000 square-foot warehouse.

episodes.name: Scrappy Go Lucky
episodes.overview: The guys visit a hardcore collector in California who's under pressure from his County to downsize. Plus, a roadside hunch leads to a bonanza of rare vintage cars.

episodes.name: No Stoner Left Unturned
episodes.overview: The guys meet a man who had pieces on display in the Smithsonian, but find that what he's held on to is even more mind-blowing. And a father/daughter power struggle is a roadblock to picking a century farm.

episodes.name: Slim Pickings
episodes.overview: The guys visit a jaw-dropping Kentucky property with a racetrack that revives an old Mike & Frank rivalry. Later, a freestyle stop in North Carolina looks like a bust until they unearth a one-of-a-kind TV relic.

episodes.name: Planes, Frames and Automobiles
episodes.overview: In an antique shop closed since the 70s, Mike and Frank go toe-to-toe with the sibling owners who negotiate for every last dollar. And, the guys come upon a historic aircraft with an amazing backstory.

episodes.name: The Joy of Sax
episodes.overview: A garage door in Indiana leads to a 1950s wagon Mike can't leave without--if he can sweeten the deal. And on a musical mission from Dani, the guys scour a farm with more than chickens and pigs.

episodes.name: Picker's Code
episodes.overview: The guys get a lead from a fellow picker, but is he a friend or competitor? Then, the toughest obstacle is making a deal with "the Godfather of Junk."

episodes.name: Another Brick in the Wall
episodes.overview: The guys have an awkward encounter with the "King of the Gypsies," who has an incredible underground stash but insists he can't be bought.

episodes.name: Bucking Bronco
episodes.overview: The guys uncover a once-in-a-lifetime find, and must decide to go big or go home. Mike gets down-and-dirty to rescue an old piece from Mother Nature.

episodes.name: Tough Nut to Crack
episodes.overview: When Frank goes nuts for a century-old snack icon, he must decide if it’s worth an unprecedented sum of money to take it home. Then, Mike falls hard for a Roaring Twenties roadster.

episodes.name: Sgt. Picker's Lonely Hearts Club
episodes.overview: At an old school drive-in, Mike and Danielle uncover a vintage reel of Beatles' footage that could be the only one of its kind.

episodes.name: Bound for Badness
episodes.overview: When a freestyle lands them on the doorstep of a former arms dealer and her Judo champion husband, the guys make a killer back-room deal.

episodes.name: Twin at all Costs
episodes.overview: On a family compound near NYC, Mike flips for the coin-op elephant in the room and a staggering collection of A-list mannequins leaves him speechless.

episodes.name: Shocked and Loaded
episodes.overview: The guys encounter a mad scientist who creates his own lightning and hypnotizes Frank.

episodes.name: High Energy Crisis
episodes.overview: The guys have their hands full with a high-strung super-collector who might bounce off the walls. Plus, Danielle lands in NYC for a high-stakes auction of rock legend memorabilia.

episodes.name: Going Down?
episodes.overview: If the guys can't get a mammoth 1929 Roadster safely down a decaying 100-year-old elevator they will be $20,000 in the hole. Plus, Mike uncovers a surprise when he hears hissing coming from beneath an out-of-control collection.

episodes.name: The Greatest Pick on Earth
episodes.overview: After a mammoth pick on a 25-acre homestead, the guys comb through the largest collection of sideshow memorabilia they've ever seen.

episodes.name: Hidden in Plane Sight
episodes.overview: The guys explore a stash of ultra-rare motorcycle parts found behind a secret wall, and they find the ultimate aviation collectible -- a propeller linked to Charles Lindbergh.

episodes.name: Hydro Homestead
episodes.overview: The guys try to buy from a super-handyman on a unique homestead, but his deal-making could end the pick before it gets going.

episodes.name: Time Warp
episodes.overview: The guys are stunned by a house with storefronts frozen in time, containing a bounty of never-sold stock and a secret bootlegging basement.

episodes.name: Concrete Jungle
episodes.overview: The guys pick New York City for the first time ever, and go back to the future at a sprawling computer store packed with a mind-blowing stockpile of 20th century technological artifacts.

episodes.name: Risks and Rewards
episodes.overview: In Detroit, Frank takes a big risk on one of the greatest pieces he’s ever seen. Plus, Mike acquires a Purple Heart along with a very special mission.

episodes.name: Rock and a Hard Place
episodes.overview: The guys get the pick of a lifetime behind the scenes at a famous tourist attraction, plus a collector in Cape Cod shuts down deal after deal until his wife steps in.

episodes.name: Catch-32
episodes.overview: The guys have their work cut out for them on a huge property with more custom ’32 Fords than they have ever seen in one place, and Danielle attempts an important military mission.

episodes.name: Beer Factor
episodes.overview: In the heartland of beer, Frank is surprised to meet an old friend; Plus, the guys secretly prepare a surprise build for Danielle.

episodes.name: Divide and Conquer
episodes.overview: The guys double-team a packed property to find what they're looking for before nightfall. Plus, Mike discovers something living in the attic.

episodes.name: Top Cars
episodes.overview: From a farm fresh '33 coupe to a heavy hitting Italian racecar, the guys explore their hottest automotive finds.

episodes.name: Down & Dirty Digs
episodes.overview: One man’s trash is Mike and Frank’s treasures as they go digging in some of the dirtiest places for rusty gold.

episodes.name: Super Sized Buys
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank find the biggest items they've ever picked, but getting these behemoths home is the hardest part.

episodes.name: The $90,000 Question
episodes.overview: When they uncover one of the rarest motorcycles in the world, Mike and Frank must muster more cash than ever before to try and seal the ultimate deal.

episodes.name: The Great Pumpkin Showdown
episodes.overview: The guys put thousands on the line to strike a deal with a tough negotiator, and they meet Hubba, a rockabilly reverend with many talents.

episodes.name: My Sweet Ford
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank find a classic 33 Ford that’s been sitting so long that a tree has grown around it. But nothing stops the guys from rescuing this rare ride.

episodes.name: Hello Jell-O
episodes.overview: Mike stumbles on a century-old Jell-O ice cream wagon worth thousands, and Robbie makes a huge offer on an iconic Ford.

episodes.name: Tunnels and Treasures
episodes.overview: While combing through a mind-blowing collection, Mike stares down the headlights of a rare Ford; and the guys pick a Tennessee home hiding a big secret.

episodes.name: Something Weird Here
episodes.overview: The guys are first in line to pick an incredible North Carolina collection of weird and wonderful circus and sideshow memorabilia.

episodes.name: Hot Rod Hero
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank discover an amazing fleet of one-of-a-kind concept cars. Some so unique they don’t even know how to price them.

episodes.name: Queen of Fortune
episodes.overview: The picking gets red, hot and blue in a Louisiana warehouse as Mike makes a move on Gypsy Grandma, the queen of arcade games.

episodes.name: Woody's Picking Paradise
episodes.overview: It’s a picking paradise as Mike and Frank come across a huge 200,000-square-foot factory turned private collection by Woody, its dumpster diving owner.

episodes.name: Superhero Heaven
episodes.overview: In a jam-packed home Mike and Frank find Superhero heaven when they come across a rare Superman comic plus the very first Spider-Man comic worth $50,000.

episodes.name: American Dream
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank roll up on a coin-op empire ruled by sisters ready to rumble for every penny.

episodes.name: Mike's Big Buy
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank are picking and dreaming in California; Mike falls for the sweetest classic Ford pick-up he's ever seen.

episodes.name: Real Knuckleheads
episodes.overview: Frank falls in love with a collectors rare Knucklehead.

episodes.name: 40 Acre Pick
episodes.overview: Plowing through a 40-acre salvage yard, Mike and Frank harvest a few lost treasures, including a never-before-seen farmer’s mini-bike.

episodes.name: Pedal Pushers
episodes.overview: Just outside the nation’s capital Mike and Frank find a stash of untouched inventory from one of the country’s oldest bicycle and sporting goods store

episodes.name: Frank's Big Day
episodes.overview: Frank jumps for joy as he and Mike pick a recently closed toy museum ready to sell their collection of treasures.

episodes.name: Hyder's Hideaway
episodes.overview: While freestyling in Virginia’s Appalachian Mountains the guys come across a hidden hideaway filled with history and even some mementos from a bluegrass legend.

episodes.name: Rat Rod Rolls
episodes.overview: With a jam-packed farmhouse, killer barn, and rare rat rod Rolls Royce, a massive Ohio collection has mega-pick potential.

episodes.name: The Mother Load
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank accept a special invite from Indiana’s Model-A Ford lady and fall hard for her ultra-rare barn-fresh Model-A tow truck.

episodes.name: Double Bubble Trouble
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank visit a hot rod mechanic with a super expensive collection of rare bubbletop cars.

episodes.name: The Jersey Jaguar
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank unleash a sleek 67 Jaguar in a New Jersey garage and later pick a general store with a Presidential past.

episodes.name: Ripe for the Picking
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank are in Napa Valley, but rather than pick grapes, they pick one of the largest wine-related collections in the world before the owner shouts “Last Call.”

episodes.name: Junkyard Wizard
episodes.overview: A junkyard wizard has an Oktoberfest gem with Frank Fritz's name written all over it.

episodes.name: Slam Dunk Junk
episodes.overview: In Chicago, Mike and Frank find a massive warehouse filled with cast off treasures including some superstar sports memorabilia that are a total slam dunk.

episodes.name: Adrenaline Junkie
episodes.overview: The guys uncover toy cars worth as much as the real thing, and a stash of custom motorbikes with an incredible backstory.

episodes.name: Cowzilla in Colorado
episodes.overview: While Frank is on the mend Mike and his brother Robbie crisscross Colorado and find a giant cow shaped RV.

episodes.name: One of Everything
episodes.overview: Mike and Robbie uncover a hidden stash of awesome motorcycle relics at a Colorado property littered with massive man-mobiles.

episodes.name: Ready to Roar
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank meet Larry who has the ultimate big boy toys including a rare Porsche and a pair of unusual pick-ups that really get the guys going.

episodes.name: Ready to Race
episodes.overview: The guys are stoked to visit a former racer and adrenaline junkie in his vintage Ohio garage.

episodes.name: Space Ranger
episodes.overview: The guys head to Minnesota on a rescue mission to help save the remains of a carnival business from Mother Nature.

episodes.name: Snow Job
episodes.overview: In the middle of a Minnesota blizzard Mike and Frank face the frost to uncover a rare pair of trucks on farmer Jim’s spread.

episodes.name: Frank's Folly
episodes.overview: Mike and Danielle join an architectural salvage crew on a special mission while Robbie and Frank hunt for treasure in an old theater turned prop warehouse.

episodes.name: Million-Dollar Cars
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank find an important part for a million-dollar car.

episodes.name: Big Money Racer
episodes.overview: On a 100-acre property in Arkansas, Mike falls hard for a midget race car with a Knucklehead motor and prize-winning pedigree.

episodes.name: Texas Treasures
episodes.overview: In the heart of oil country, a family’s vintage service station is just like a petroliana museum where the awesome inventory is all off limits.

episodes.name: Texas Pick'em
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank are deep in the heart of Texas where they play a couple of hands of Texas Pick’em with some savvy collectors.

episodes.name: Roll Like a Rock Star
episodes.overview: When the guys get a lead on what could be Aerosmith’s original tour van, they head out on a cross-country trek in search of the holy grail of rock’n’roll relics.

episodes.name: Big Tennessee Welcome
episodes.overview: In Nashville, Danielle introduces the guys to a former Chevy dealership that could provide an awesome new home base.

episodes.name: Bubba Gump Picks
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank are in Pickin’ heaven when they come across a mammoth collection of militaria that includes Civil War revolvers and even Forrest Gump’s original footlocker.

episodes.name: Eyes on the Prize
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank purchase optical items from an optometrist and his wife. While cruising through Florida, the guys go hog wild in a former juke joint-turned-picker’s paradise, built in 1927.

episodes.name: The Doctor is Waiting
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank are scolded when they arrive late for an appointment with Dr. Fred. But once they get past his grumpy assistant, they find themselves in a strange world filled with all kinds of weird and wonderful things.

episodes.name: Pickin' for the Fences
episodes.overview: In Oklahoma, the guys uncover a baseball signed by one of the greatest players of all time.

episodes.name: Mighty Micro-Madness
episodes.overview: Mike has an epiphany in New Hampshire when he finds a mighty collection of microcars including one of the rarest in the world.

episodes.name: One Wheel Deal
episodes.overview: In Missouri, the guys visit an historic homestead where they join the search for grandpa’s lost Civil War uniform.

episodes.name: High Flying Pick
episodes.overview: Lost for half a century, the guys heroically return a naval artifact to its rightful home in Washington, D.C.

episodes.name: Hard Bargain Picks
episodes.overview: While driving Route 66 in Kansas, the guys visit an old hangar packed with jaw-dropping collection of vintage cars.

episodes.name: Pickers Like it Hot
episodes.overview: In Massachusetts, the guys try to broker a deal on an original Bowie Knife and discover a Hollywood collection with never seen photos of Marilyn Monroe that Frank goes gaga over.

15.name: Season 15
15.overview: Frank and Mike tour the country in search of more fascinating finds, traveling from a Texas ranch to a Northern California artist's hideout.

episodes.name: Pick Your Battle
episodes.overview: Mike and Danielle pick an over-the-top, tiki-party-meets-rockabilly home while Frank and Robbie set their sights on a vast collection hidden in the fortified bunkers of an old army base.

episodes.name: The Great Pickoff
episodes.overview: The great pick-off continues as Mike and Danielle continue their team effort to take on Frank and Robbie for ultimate picking bragging rights.

episodes.name: Picker's Dozen
episodes.overview: A century-old Italian grocery store turned time capsule features an early 20th century delivery truck and a secret crypt that's calling Mike's name.

episodes.name: Presidential Picks
episodes.overview: The Pickers are on a Presidential Trail as Mike and Danielle head for Pennsylvania while Frank and Robbie are on a whistle stop tour of North Dakota.

episodes.name: Pick Like a Honey Badger
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank are itching to see what is inside a barn that has been off limits for a quarter of a century. And while Mike makes like a honey badger, bundle master Frank strikes again.

episodes.name: Raiders of the Lost Pick
episodes.overview: Mike and Danielle crawl into a Pittsburgh time capsule while Frank and Robbie plow through six generations of stuff on one of Michigan's oldest farms.

episodes.name: Rock'n'Roll Heaven
episodes.overview: It's all Rock and Roll as the guys tackle the painstaking preservation of Aerosmith's original tour van while a star-struck Frank picks one of his teen idols.

episodes.name: Pick This Way
episodes.overview: Aerosmith's legendary tour van gets an overhaul just in time for a visit from Rock'n'Roll royalty

episodes.name: The Michigan Madman
episodes.overview: The guys stumble upon two of the fastest motorcycles ever built and they are determined to save them from oblivion.

episodes.name: The Mysterious Madame X
episodes.overview: Mike and Mefford, the mechanic, are on the hunt for Madame X -- a legendary one-of-a-kind 1929 Cadillac. But is it real?

episodes.name: Space Invaders Smackdown
episodes.overview: The guys are ready to light up the sky when they pick a Detroit warehouse packed with vintage searchlights. Then Frank risks everything on a game of Space Invaders.

episodes.name: Frank Meet Brank
episodes.overview: The guys have high hopes when they uncover a sexy 1935 Auburn roadster on an Indiana farm, but end up with just a kiddie ride instead.

episodes.name: Van-Tastic
episodes.overview: The boys uncover a treasure trove of VW buses in Arkansas. With the collection under threat from vandals, Mike is determined to rescue as many as possible.

episodes.name: Corvette King
episodes.overview: The gang heads to a gas pump graveyard in Louisiana. Danielle looks for a home for a pair of drag bikes.

episodes.name: Alabama Rolls
episodes.overview: An Alabama couple has one of the biggest collections the guys have ever come across, including a number of high-octane cars saved from the scrap heap.

episodes.name: Aerosmith Van
episodes.overview: After picking an awesome surf museum in California, Mike and Frank catch up with the Aerosmith van in Vegas. Then drive it down the strip to meet their rock ‘n’ roll idols for the big reveal.

episodes.name: Georgia On My Mind
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank hightail it to Georgia hoping to snap up a super rare roadster and get it back on the highway.

episodes.name: Double DeLorean Delight
episodes.overview: On a ramshackle New Jersey estate, Mike and Danielle go on a Back-to-the-Future joyride in a DeLorean.

episodes.name: Freaky Florida
episodes.overview: In a freaky Florida town steeped with Carnival history, Mike gambles big on the mother lode of must-have circus banners.

episodes.name: California Picking
episodes.overview: In the mountains of Southern California, the guys start their pick in an old train caboose and make off with a bulging bounty of cool old signs.

episodes.name: Say Sohio
episodes.overview: Frank falls super hard for a 63 Corvette Stingray and he keeps raising his offer that it makes Robbie wonder if this is really Frank. Meanwhile Mike and Mefford kick off an ambitious restoration project.

episodes.name: Hollywood Honey Hole
episodes.overview: The guys find a Hollywood honey hole when they meet a stuntman from Hollywood's Golden Age; Al's California garage is overflowing with mind-blowing memorabilia.

episodes.name: Knucklehead Frank
episodes.overview: In Southern California, Frank gets a lesson in Knucklehead Zen when the guys visit Andy--a kindred spirit and international man of mystery.

episodes.name: Tick Tock Frank
episodes.overview: Frank “tick-tock” Fritz is over the moon when the guys pick a Portland clock shop that’s a showcase for vintage mechanical wonders of all kinds.

episodes.name: Picking Through the Ashes
episodes.overview: At an historic Oregon flour mill, the guys tour the site of a massive restoration project and pick up some awesome items that will help in the rebuilding.

episodes.name: Jolene, Jolene
episodes.overview: An old walnut farm in California has barns that have not seen the light of day in years and just might contain the Holy Grail of vintage workwear.

episodes.name: Dani Goes East
episodes.overview: It’s tattoo mania in New York as Mike and Danielle pick through an artist’s high-end collection of flash art. Then Mike uncovers a 100-year-old papier mache Uncle Sam. In Ohio, Frank and Robbie bumble through four stories of junk in search of hidden treasures.

episodes.name: Double Barn Bonanza
episodes.overview: In rural New York, the guys dive into back-to-back epic picks where the incredible collections tell the story of America.

episodes.name: Wolves in Picker's Clothes
episodes.overview: Mike and Robbie are trying to tackle a trio of vintage Fords but their sibling rivalry threatens to blow up the deal.

episodes.name: Mr. Whizzer
episodes.overview: Honoring their late father and his massive stockpile of rusty gold, two sisters in Upstate New York invite the guys to pick through Dad’s epic untouched garage.

episodes.name: A Bronx Tale
episodes.overview: From a storied boatyard in the Bronx to an untouched 1970s mancave in Oregon, the guys tackle two mind-blowing bicoastal picks.

episodes.name: Dani's Picker-versary
episodes.overview: Danielle’s 10th anniversary with Antique Archaeology becomes a surprise party for Mike when she turns the milestone into a major league event complete with a Hollywood ending.

episodes.name: Midwest Mayhem
episodes.overview: A super-sized Chicago machine shop leaves the guys breathless, while Danielle and Robbie search for curios at an Odd Fellows Home-turned-winery.

episodes.name: Pickin' Safari
episodes.overview: Teeming with taxidermy, Ron’s Illinois home is like Pet Sematary meets the Natural History Museum.

episodes.name: Motor Mania
episodes.overview: When the guys are wowed by an epic Iowa collection of classic cars and motorbikes, Danielle and Robbie hail Milwaukee’s king of coin-op.

episodes.name: Back Road Buys
episodes.overview: Mike and Frank hit a down and dirty old-school pick in Illinois while Danielle and Robbie enjoy a high-speed joyride in a one-of-a-kind rat rod.

episodes.name: Burlesque Queen
episodes.overview: In Illinois, Mike and Frank comb through a mind-blowing historic marina while in Kansas City, Danielle brokers a deal on the mother of all burlesque collections.

episodes.name: Cruisin'
episodes.overview: Mike and Dave go hog wild for a former Minnesota car dealership that's now home to scores of dusty projects and a one-of-a-kind miniature cruise ship.

episodes.name: Young Grasshopper
episodes.overview: In Minnesota, the founder of Memoryville opens the doors to his vintage wonderland while Mefford-the-mechanic has an update on the legendary Madame X Cadillac.

episodes.name: Chopper King
episodes.overview: A jaw-dropping Arizona property features antique motorbikes as far as the eye can see, and in Tennessee, an ultra-rare Zephyr gets a tire-blowing test drive.

episodes.name: The Ghost of the West
episodes.overview: In New Mexico, Mike and Danielle make an epic stagecoach stop and visit a frozen-in-time adobe village complete with ghost stories and a Wild West saloon.

episodes.name: Moonshine and Motors
episodes.overview: Bobby's seven-generation Georgia homestead offers it's Southern picking.

episodes.name: Georgia Wonderland
episodes.overview: While Robbie crosses the Rockies with a legendary car in tow, Mike and Mefford go for a high-speed joyride in a banned muscle car without breaks.

episodes.name: Zephyrville
episodes.overview: In Florida, Mike meets a gun-slinging cowboy who reels him with tales from the golden age of Hollywood westerns.

episodes.name: Desert Gold Rush
episodes.overview: It's a banner day in Arizona with back-to-back picks featuring a late artist's one-of-a-kind collection and a jaw-dropping stash of vintage hi-fi.

episodes.name: Pumps, Prints and Picks
episodes.overview: Mike and Jersey Jon dive into a century-old Connecticut print shop while Robbie and Danielle unearth a rare globe at a 1920s truck stop.

episodes.name: Hidden Harley
episodes.overview: An historic New Hampshire farm features 300 years of forgotten treasures, and in Pennsylvania, Robbie finds a 1936 Harley hiding in plain sight.

episodes.name: Smoking Hot Chevy
episodes.overview: In Florida, Mike and Mefford hone in on an immaculate 1964 Chevy pickup and uncover a circus scrapbook with never-before-seen photos of Elvis.

episodes.name: Country Queen
episodes.overview: In Tennessee, Mike meets one of the giants of country music history, while Robbie and Danielle uncover a barn-fresh Impala at the perfect Pennsylvania pick.

episodes.name: Burgers and Ballrooms
episodes.overview: Mike finds the world's most famous hamburger icon in a Massachusetts chicken coop while Danielle dances through history at a defunct 1940s studio turned time capsule.

episodes.name: Bombshells and Silk
episodes.overview: Mike and Jersey John visit a prolific Cape Cod collector while Danielle and Robbie uncover amazing American souvenirs and Queen Victoria's silk stockings in Pennsylvania.

episodes.name: Brothers and Burlesque
episodes.overview: Mike and Robbie go wild for a killer main street pick in Tennessee while Danielle visits Cleveland's queen of burlesque to close the deal on a racy piece of history.

episodes.name: Hollywood Hot Rods
episodes.overview: Mike and Dave scour a visionary collector's stash of amusement park relics while Danielle and Robbie visit a jaw-dropping line-up of original Hollywood hotrods.

episodes.name: A Record Deal
episodes.overview: Mike and Jersey Jon scour a massive family stockpile in Connecticut while Danielle and Robbie uncover an ultra-rare Beatles memento in a jam-packed Pennsylvania home.

episodes.name: Rock 'n Go
episodes.overview: Mike uncovers a stockpile of vintage relics from a time when toys could kill, and Danielle breaks a sweat over a trunk of ultra-rare concert tees worth their weight in gold.

episodes.name: Hollywood in Texas
episodes.overview: In Texas, Retro Rick opens the doors to his stockpile of Hollywood relics. And, Robbie is determined to reunite two halves of an ultra-rare gas globe.

episodes.name: Big Tex
episodes.overview: Cruising through the Lone Star State, the Wolfe brothers visit a one-of-a-kind home that was custom-built around a staggering Texas-size collection.

episodes.name: Fort Knox of Toys
episodes.overview: The Wolfe brothers go nuts when junkyard Ron opens the doors to his jaw-dropping Fort Knox of high-end toys near Dallas, and Mike hones in on the Holy Grail of VWs in Ohio.

episodes.name: Picking Nirvana
episodes.overview: In Ohio, a late friend's picking nirvana has the Wolfe brothers howling. With a successful demolition business and an eye for treasure, Brian amassed a mind-boggling collection of rare oversize gems. And, honoring both his memory and his wife, the brothers drop big money pieces that tell the story of America. Meanwhile, back in Tennessee, Mefford calls in the experts for a killer paint job on the shop's exterior.

episodes.name: Return of the Impala
episodes.overview: Mike and Danielle geek out over a collection of oddball antiques in Ohio while a thrilling joyride in his new vintage Impala leaves Robbie stranded.

episodes.name: Racy Relics
episodes.overview: Mike and Jersey John fall hard for a grand South Carolina home; Danielle scores a few racy relics in Mississippi.

episodes.name: Fiddles and Picks
episodes.overview: Mike and Jersey Jon hone in on some big-money picks in North Carolina, while Danielle and Robbie meet a legendary bluegrass fiddler who has an awesome Nashville collection.

episodes.name: Paradise Picking
episodes.overview: Robbie gets revved up for a time-travel bike in Mississippi, and Mike unearths a barn-fresh 1932 pickup in North Carolina that hasn't seen the light of day in 50 years.

episodes.name: Secrets of the Hotel
episodes.overview: Mike and Jersey Jon travel to North Carolina; Danielle and Robbie uncover the celebrated history of a legendary Kentucky hotel.

episodes.name: Radioactive Rust
episodes.overview: A retired Air Force general reveals the story of his American Dream; meanwhile Robbie and Danielle are dazzled by the glow of a rare collection of radioactive glass.

episodes.name: Homestead Honey Hole
episodes.overview: The Wolfe brothers tour a massive West Virginia homestead complete with an antique auto showroom; and in Texas, an ex-drag racer with a mountain of petroliana is in the mood to sell.

episodes.name: Coal Gold
episodes.overview: In West Virginia, the Wolfe brothers pick a century-old soda shop that's frozen in time, and a Methodist minister and circus ringleader opens the doors to his eye-popping collection.

episodes.name: Joyridin' Pick
episodes.overview: A Maryland car fanatic opens the doors to his late father's massive collection; after Robbie takes a joyride back to the '70s, Mike revs up a retro British taxi

episodes.name: Skateboards and Gutter Balls
episodes.overview: A California almond farm serves up a hidden stash of retro surf shop relics, and a Prohibition-era bowling alley in L.A. offers a mind-blowing trip back in time.

episodes.name: Country Road Gold
episodes.overview: Mike and Robbie visit an old-school general store filled with country road gold. And a serious collector opens the doors to his empire of vintage coin-op scales.

episodes.name: Movie Magic Picking
episodes.overview: Mike, and Robbie head for the Hollywood Hills to pick a once-in-a-lifetime stockpile of amazing movie memorabilia.

episodes.name: The King of Signs
episodes.overview: Robbie unveils his sprawling retro garage, and in Southern California, the Wolfe brothers come face-to-face with the King of Signs and uncover the Holy Grail of 3D signs.

episodes.name: Cadillac Man
episodes.overview: The Wolfe brothers uncover an overgrown vintage Cadillac graveyard in the woods, and peel back the layers of a gargantuan California stockpile.

episodes.name: Picking Frisco
episodes.overview: The Wolfe brothers drop in on an historic San Francisco hotel that's home to an awesome collection of classic cars and uncover a hidden stash of spooky carnival relics.

episodes.name: Picture Perfect Pick
episodes.overview: In the California desert, the Wolfe brothers comb through a late photographer's eclectic hide-away and enter a sprawling ranch that's home to a must-have holy neon beacon.

episodes.name: High Speed Picking
episodes.overview: Mike visits the Virginia birthplace of a high-speed camera that changed the world. Meanwhile in Nashville, a music guru has some sobering news about Danielle's rock'n'roll gamble.

episodes.name: Pinball Jack
episodes.overview: In the heart of beer country, the Wolfe brothers find the motherlode of breweriana, the granddaddy of all pinball machines, and Elvis inside a Milwaukee collector's suburban home. Down the road, Mike and Robbie make a return pilgrimage to an Illinois honey hole to dig through five generations of history in a century-old mansion full of treasure.

episodes.name: Wolves in Wisconsin
episodes.overview: On Uncle Butch's ten-acre homestead in Wisconsin, the Wolfe brothers pay big money for some rare nuggets of petroliana but strike out on a jaw-dropping ride with a Hollywood pedigree. Flying solo in Milwaukee, Mike meets the 97-year-old inventor whose life-like automatons tell the story of America's all-time favorite characters.

episodes.name: Searching in Selma
episodes.overview: Mike and Jersey uncover a massive collection of petroliana in Alabama while Dani and Robbie hit an Arizona property with killer steam engines.

episodes.name: Shelby in the Barn
episodes.overview: Mike goes hog wild for a super-rare, barn-fresh Shelby Mustang in Alabama.

episodes.name: Rocket Ray Round-Up
episodes.overview: A Wisconsin collector's oversize storage units feature a bonanza of new old stock, a bale of shredded cash, a gargantuan pistol--and a motivated seller who keeps lowering his prices. Down the road, a former drag racer opens the doors to his museum-quality stockpile of petroliana featuring homemade engine cutaways, a stable full of early Chevrolets, and a barn-fresh must-have pickup.

episodes.name: Pool Hall Picking
episodes.overview: Mike uncovers an ultra-rare pinball machine in Louisiana while Robbie and Jersey uncover an epic property packed with rusty cars.

episodes.name: Flea Market Junkie
episodes.overview: Mike and Jersey visit a flea market junkie in Louisiana while Robbie and Danielle scour a jam-packed Arizona property where nearly everything is for sale.

episodes.name: The Alabama Slamma
episodes.overview: A mind-blowing Alabama collection includes a century of salvage, and in Mississippi, Robbie dives into the huge remains of a family's carnival empire.

episodes.name: Knucklehead Blue
episodes.overview: Mike uncovers a mind-blowing collection of vintage baseball cards in Kansas while Robbie and Jersey try to broker a deal in Tommy's "black hole of stuff."

episodes.name: Big Bucks Bubbles
episodes.overview: Mike makes a return pilgrimage to Rick's Michigan honey hole. And this time he's determined to seal the deal on a ratty t-shirt and futuristic one-of-a-kind bubble car--no matter how big the price tag. Down the road, Robbie and Jersey comb through a late collector's sprawling workshop where everything is ups for grabs including a bright green dune buggy.

episodes.name: The Wizard's Castle
episodes.overview: In the thumb of Michigan, a homeowner's inventive great granddad left behind a cutting-edge property complete with a custom zip line, water park, and private speakeasy; at a defunct museum down the road, Danielle closes in on a claw-foot bathtub.

episodes.name: Naughty and Nice
episodes.overview: Mike and Danielle scour a sensory-overload attic in Detroit while Jersey and Robbie follow a random lead to a late collector's mighty stockpile.

episodes.name: Picking Larry Land
episodes.overview: In Nebraska, the Wolfe brothers comb through Larry Land--an epic 27,000-square-foot hangar full of choice coin-op, carnival relics and more. The good news is that owner Larry is ready to make a deal. Down the road in Kansas, Mike-the-veterinarian has filled the house next door with all kinds of treasures that boggles the mind.

episodes.name: Jack Is Back
episodes.overview: In Detroit, rock 'n' roll legend Jack White unveils his needle-in-a-haystack quest to track down a historic one-of-a-kind recording trailer that's been AWOL for decades.

episodes.name: Small Towns, Big Picking
episodes.overview: A Pennsylvania preservationist opens the doors to his jaw-dropping historic properties; the Wolfe brothers sift through a rockstar picker's off-limits collection.

episodes.name: Wolfes Go West
episodes.overview: In Nebraska, the Wolfe brothers visit a third-generation pioneer village that features a visionary's mighty collection--along with a dozen massive outbuildings that haven't been opened since the 50s.

episodes.name: Corvette Me Not
episodes.overview: A scavenger hunt begins for Mike as he excavates a barn-fresh, classic Corvette; Robbie and Jersey sift through 150 years of history on a Michigan family farm.

episodes.name: $135,000 Pick
episodes.overview: A late collector's home features a stockpile of wheels; Mike offers six figures to take home five rare motorbikes; Danielle nails a mission for Jack White; Robbie and Dave transport a legendary recording trailer to its new home in Detroit.

episodes.name: Junkyard Jewels
episodes.overview: Robbie and Jersey comb through a homewrecker's massive cache of architectural salvage, and Mike is determined to rescue a trio of dented Porsches.

episodes.name: Gladiators of the Track
episodes.overview: In Pittsburgh, a real-life heavy metal hero reveals his mind-boggling stockpile. And in Tennessee, the team revs up for a white-knuckle winner-takes-all go-kart smackdown.

episodes.name: It's a Woody
episodes.overview: Robbie is determined to buy the granddaddy of woody trailers, and Mike turns to one of the best mechanics in the country to breathe life into a bundle of ultra-rare Harleys and Indians.

episodes.name: Detroit Dreaming
episodes.overview: At Detroit's abandoned Packard plant, Mike gets a tour of an American landmark before it disappears. And in Buffalo, Retro Ron's collection features the Holy Grail of vintage bikes.

episodes.name: Little Shop of Wonders
episodes.overview: Mike and Jersey pick a little shop of wonder in the heart of Manhattan. And Robbie chases down the holy grail of brass-era signs.

episodes.name: Prince of the Subway
episodes.overview: Mike tries pole dancing when a dumpster-diving artist invites him in. And Robbie and Jersey uncover a bonanza of antique signs from the NYC subway.

episodes.name: Baron of the Skies
episodes.overview: The Wolfe brothers seal the deal on a one-of-a-kind bi-plane. And an appraiser has good news--and bad news--about a pricey Wild West impulse purchase.

episodes.name: Mega Pick Madness
episodes.overview: Junk drunk on a hotly anticipated return visit to a legendary Florida collector, Mike picks up a mind-blowing piece of Civil Rights history and a to-die-for Schwinn Paramount with an heroic cross-country pedigree. Meanwhile in California, Robbie and Jersey are determined to seal the deal on a folk-art masterpiece of America’s most iconic landmark.

episodes.name: Kingdom of Lost Junk
episodes.overview: The owner of an automotive boneyard is in the mood to sell. And a California collector's kingdom of junk is home to one of the rarest motorbikes in the world.

episodes.name: Beware of Deere
episodes.overview: In Michigan, Danielle falls for a collection of John Deere toys. And in Niagara Falls, three sisters open the doors to their late father's antique time capsule.

episodes.name: King of Salvage
episodes.overview: In the Pacific Northwest, the Wolfe Brothers are on the loose and get inside the salvage king's huge 200,000 square foot fortress-like warehouse filled with all kinds of treasures.

episodes.name: Picking the Godfather
episodes.overview: The Pacific Northwest is a picking paradise as Mike crashes into the godfather of Italian scooters while Robbie and Jersey nearly drown in a sea of smalls.

episodes.name: Classic Car Cemetary
episodes.overview: In South Carolina, the Wolfe brothers pick a main street grocery that's frozen in time, and pay a visit to Sammy's classic car paradise.

episodes.name: Hidden Car Stash
episodes.overview: Mike and Jersey go hog wild over a West Virginia honey hole, and Danielle uncovers a stash of cash in a hidden compartment.

episodes.name: Mike and Homer
episodes.overview: While cruising through Southern California on a special mission for Danielle, Mike uncovers a legendary signed guitar along with story boards and scripts from America's favorite cartoon family, The Simpsons. Clear across the country, Robbie and Jersey dive into a massive stockpile of vintage electronics--and honor a late North Carolina collector's legacy in the process.

episodes.name: Picking Against Time
episodes.overview: On the hunt for a delectable Porsche, Mike speed-picks in South Carolina while Rob and Jersey visit a motel-size collection of petroliana.

episodes.name: Kiddie Car Heaven
episodes.overview: Mike stumbles upon a once-in-a-lifetime camera collection in upstate New York; Robbie goes hog wild for a massive stash of junior dream cars.

episodes.name: The Five-Generation Pick
episodes.overview: On a small-town main street in Indiana, Mike picks through a time-capsule drugstore with an attic full of apothecary relics that are all up for grabs; down the road in West Virginia, Robbie and Jersey visit a family farm from the 1800s.

episodes.name: The Mile-Long Yard Sale
episodes.overview: Mike and Jersey trip out over an Oddfellow's Lodge in Maryland, and visit one man's combination theme park, art installation and roadside attraction.

episodes.name: The Eyes Have It
episodes.overview: In North Carolina, Mike, and Jersey dive into a mad-scientist collection of antique quackery and medical equipment; in California, Larry's barn features a multi-generational stockpile of vintage motorbikes, cars, and leather gear.

episodes.name: Roadside Relics
episodes.overview: Mike uncovers a Godzilla-size stockpile of vintage movie posters, and Robbie pays up for a pair of ultra-rare Chevy signs for the shop in Tennessee.

episodes.name: Tough As Nails
episodes.overview: Jody's late father left behind a supersized Ohio collection that includes, five hangars, a Ferris wheel, and a steamboat--and after years of careful negotiation, this tough-as-nails negotiator is finally ready to make a deal.

episodes.name: The Boneyard
episodes.overview: While combing through his buddy's bad-to-the-bone boneyard in Cleveland, Mike uncovers a massive stash of brass-era bikes--and is determined to buy them all. Meanwhile, during an Illinois heat wave, Robbie and Jersey are the first to wade through a late collector's stockpile of early tools and the machines that built America.

episodes.name: Farm Fresh
episodes.overview: With a fleet of pricey cars and barns exploding with top-notch treasures, Mike and Robbie have high hopes for a sprawling family farm in Ohio; in West Virginia, the Wolfe brothers pick the scratch-and-dent room of Clifford's automobile museum.

episodes.name: Knockout Salvage
episodes.overview: Flying solo in Wisconsin, Mike gets VIP access to a legendary race car driver's vast collection of motorbikes and memorabilia and is determined to drive away with one of his prized two-wheelers. Down the road in Minnesota, Robbie and Jersey help an overwhelmed collector thin out his stockpile of knockout signs and architectural salvage.

episodes.name: Runaway Train
episodes.overview: In Illinois, Robbie and Jersey get exclusive access to a former race car driver's stockpile where they uncover rare car parts, pristine toys, and epic stories from the racetrack. Down the road, Mike falls hard for a small-town Wisconsin train museum where he scours the scratch-and-dent department for a good cause.

episodes.name: Motorcycle Mancave
episodes.overview: It's a meeting of the minds in Illinois as Mike picks a three-generation family business where the prolific collector's granddaughter knows the backstory of every single item. Down the road--at a motorbike enthusiast's mancave--Robbie pays up for a practice bomb and Jersey steps in to preserve a legendary racer's legacy.

episodes.name: Evel Empire
episodes.overview: Mike learns about Evel Knievel's rocket-powered Snake Canyon jump and is determined to buy a one of a kind billboard rescued from the site from a Michigan man who was there; Jersey and Robbie rummage through a late car-lover's massive stockpile.

episodes.name: Wolfemen vs. The Automatons
episodes.overview: On a California dream pick, the competitive pinball-wizard Wolfe brothers meet coin-op king Dirk at his giant poultry barn turned private arcade.

episodes.name: The Great Razooly
episodes.overview: Flying solo, Mike heads to the California castle home of the Great Razooly--a sculptor, entrepreneur, and horror icon whose one-of-a-kind collection includes monsters, gargoyles and a custom rocket ship on the front lawn.

episodes.name: The DIY Delorean
episodes.overview: Mike meets a kindred spirit at a defunct Wisconsin railroad town and uncovers vintage treasures and new old stock in a jaw-dropping space that's frozen in time; in Illinois, Robbie becomes obsessed with getting a one-of-a-kind DeLorean knockoff.

episodes.name: Carnival Cash Out
episodes.overview: In Minnesota, Mike and Jersey go hog wild for a four-generation carny collection complete with carousel horses, toy tanks, and bumper cars; down the road in New Hampshire, on a special mission for Robbie, the guys head to Roger's analog laboratory.

episodes.name: Pickin' Wall-to-Wall
episodes.overview: Mike meets a passionate Connecticut picker with major inventory--but getting access to his collection means dismantling a massive, layered wall of stuff.
